intro: Boechera johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Boechera johnstonii is often found in alpine and arctic regions, showcasing its adaptability to cold, harsh environments.
